kernfrasen: resistance to the newness of God
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS RESISTANCE TO AN OCCUPYING POWER

kernfrasen: come out of the great ordeal
step outside the box of the empire
keep the lid on human hope

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Step outside the box of the empire

cognitieve_implicaties: The current world is restrictive and artificial
theologische_implicaties: God exists outside of human political structures
ethische_implicaties: The believer must actively seek an exit from consumerist norms
onbedoelde_consequenties: May imply that the physical world is inherently evil (Gnosticism)

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the 'box' cliché by applying it to the totalizing power of the Roman and modern empires.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd

cognitieve_implicaties: True power is found in vulnerability, not force
theologische_implicaties: Theodicy is resolved through God's participation in suffering
ethische_implicaties: Strength is measured by the ability to endure and care
onbedoelde_consequenties: Mixing of species (Lamb/Shepherd) can create cognitive dissonance

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Standard biblical imagery, though the preacher attempts to revitalize it by contrasting it with 'hard power'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher maintains a consistent binary between 'Empire' (Hard Power/Container) and 'Gospel' (Vulnerability/Path).

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher emphasizes vulnerability, yet Peter uses a 'command' that 'breaks the charm' like a forceful act.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Vulnerability entails yielding; Command entails imposition.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Functional overlap: The Lamb's vulnerability is the source of the Shepherd's authority to lead.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses the mundane 'airplane seat' story to ground the abstract 'Great Ordeal' in embodied choice.
sterktes.voorbeeld: I would want the aisle seat... our life consists in such small decisions.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'Empire' is defined so broadly (corporations, media, government) it may create a 'us vs. them' siege mentality.
risicos.voorbeeld: The empire of Rome as our empire today—has all the power.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may feel alienated from civic participation.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A cosmic courtroom/battlefield where the Empire is on trial and the Lamb is being enthroned.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; connects the 'big' vision to 'small' action.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforced through the imagery of leading to water and wiping tears.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the 'Good Shepherd Sunday' (Easter 4) by redefining the Shepherd as a survivor of the Ordeal.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the MILITARY/POLITICAL domain, framed as a conflict between two kingdoms. It successfully uses the ARCHITECTURAL 'box' metaphor to describe ideological capture. The transition from the ECONOMIC 'small decisions' to the MILITARY 'great ordeal' is the cognitive bridge of the sermon.

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washing in the blood (implied by Rev 7)
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'washing' to the 'tears' and 'water of life' to emphasize cleansing from the 'dirt' of the empire.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The blood isn't a chemical; it's the solidarity of the Lamb in our own wounds.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify that the 'miracle' is not a display of 'hard power' but the natural outcome of a life no longer afraid of death.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If the world is a box, the only goal is to leave it.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that 'making all things new' happens inside the world, not just by escaping it.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To soften the military edge and emphasize 'imagination' mentioned in the text.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the gap between ancient apocalyptic literature and modern political/personal reality.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'mouthful' phrasing, CMT reveals how the 'mouthful' functions as a schema-disruption tool.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher uses the 'Airplane' experience as a concrete source domain to map onto the abstract 'Ordeal'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's power comes from mapping 'Small Decisions' (Source) onto 'Faith' (Target), making an abstract virtue quantifiable and actionable.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Shape and character of our lives
Keep the lid on human hope
appendices.notities: The preacher effectively uses 'vulnerability' as a counter-metaphor to 'empire,' creating a cognitive tension that is resolved in the figure of the Lamb.
